responses.text: You stand before Caligula. What is it you want?
State your business; Rome does not wait.
I am as well as an emperor should be. Why do you ask?
My mood shifts like the Tiber, but I remain in command.
Concern for my health? Focus instead on your question.
Do not linger on courtesy; make use of my time.
Very well. Now, what else do you seek?
I was born in the year they call 12 AD. Count for yourself.
Time bends to an emperor, but by your reckoning I am in my twenties.
Age matters less than power. I have both.
I am Gaius Julius Caesar Augustus Germanicus, though Rome calls me Caligula.
Name me as the legions do: Caligula, emperor of Rome.
